III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation A staff member took a youth to their personal residence on
numerous occasions in the past month where they engaged in
drinking and getting high. The staff member took the youth and a
friend to stores where the staff member was aware that they
would shoplift.
Investigation It was alleged Staff 2 took Youth A to Staff 2's residence and
engaged in drinking and drug use, as well as enable shoplifting.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 11/22/2024.
Complainant stated Youth A reported to Staff 1 that Staff 2 took
Youth A to Staff 2's residence where they engaged in drinking,
drug use, and going to a local Meijers store to shoplift.
Complainant stated Staff1 reported the allegations to Complainant
and Complainant subsequently filed a complaint report regarding
the allegations. Complainant stated Staff 2 was suspended
pending the outcome of the investigation.
I interviewed Staff 1 with DHHS Worker on 11/26/2024. Staff 1
stated she has been an independent living worker/staff for over 2
years. Staff 1 stated Youth A alleged to Staff 1 that Staff 2 took
Youth A to Staff 2's residence where they drank, used drugs, and
went to a local Meijers store where Staff 2's roommate was
dropped off to go into the store and shoplift. Staff 1 described
Youth A as nervous or scared and Staff 1 stated Youth A refused
to talk to anyone else about the allegations. Staff 1 stated Staff 2
would sometimes take other youth off campus, but Staff 1 had
never seen Staff 2 take Youth A off campus.
I interviewed Complainant with DHHS Worker on 11/26/2024.
Complainant stated it is not unusual for staff to take youth off
campus for a variety of reasons. Complainant stated she never
saw Staff 2 spend an unusual amount of time with Youth A.
Complainant stated that every event Staff 2 has taken youth off
campus was pre-approved. Complainant stated the agency likes
to hire staff that have had similar experiences growing up in the
child welfare system so the staff can better relate to the
experiences/feelings that youth may have that the staff works with.
Complainant described Staff 2 as one of these types of staff.
Complainant reported a weakness of this direction is that the staff
may sometimes have boundary issues with the youth.
Complainant described Staff 2 as sometimes having boundary
issues that are addressed in performance evaluations. Staff 2
would sometimes relate to youth more as a peer rather than a
2

staff member. Complainant and State Worker did not find any
texts on phones between Staff 2 and Youth A to indicate any
inappropriate communication/contacts.
I interviewed Staff 2 with DHHS Worker on 11/26/2024. Staff 2
stated she will be employed as a Youth Development Specialist a
year in December 2024. Staff 2 stated she learned about the
investigation in a voicemail from Complainant. Staff 2 stated she
works in the residential program as well as the independent living
program. Staff 2 denied taking Youth A or any youth to Staff 2's
residence. Staff 2 denied all of the allegations. Staff 2 stated she
doesn't have a roommate, but Staff 2's sister and the sister's
girlfriend did stay with Staff 2 for a brief period of time until they
could relocate. Staff 2 stated she did not know why anyone would
make the allegations. Staff 2 reported having a closer relationship
with another youth in the program and only interacted with Youth
A occasionally. Staff 2 denied having Youth A's phone number
and only transported Youth A at times for Youth A to visit Youth
A's dad.
I interviewed Program Manager with DHHS Worker on
11/26/2024. Program Manager described Youth A as lying
sometimes, but she didn't think Youth A would make false
allegations. Program Manager stated she did not have any
previous concerns regarding Staff 2. Program Manager stated
staff are allowed to take youth off campus.
I interviewed Program Supervisor with DHHS Worker on
11/26/2024. Program Supervisor is Staff 2's direct supervisor.
Program Supervisor described Staff 2 as "great", takes initiative,
interacts well with youth, treats all youth fairly, applies criticism for
change when the need is identified. Program Supervisor stated
she has no concerns with Staff 2. Program Supervisor stated she
has not observed any recent boundary issues between Staff 2 and
youth. Program Supervisor described Staff 2 as being friendly
with youth, but not alarming.
I interviewed Youth B with DHHS Worker on 12/16/2024. Youth
B is placed in the residential program but has contact with youth
participating in the independent living program. Youth B stated
she did not know any staff that would provide youth with vapes or
anything else inappropriate. Youth B stated youth don't text the
staff except to get rides, etc. Youth B stated she had no staff
concerns.
3

Youth A refused to be interviewed by this consultant, DHHS
Worker, or anyone else as a part of this investigation. Youth A did
comment to Program Manager that Youth A was drunk when
Youth A reported the allegations.
I participated in a pre-disposition conference with DHHS Worker
on 12/16/2024. DHHS Worker reported no findings as a part of
DHHS Workers investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
I received and reviewed personnel and training information for
Staff 2. Staff 2 received 1 verbal warning related to Staff 2's
performance in the residential program unrelated to any issues of
this investigation.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per the interviews that were
completed indicated the allegations were unfounded.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted into allegations that a staff member (Staff 2) at a childcare facility took a youth (Youth A) to the staff member's residence for drinking and drug use, and facilitated shoplifting. The investigation, which included interviews with staff and a complainant, found the allegations to be unfounded, as the accused staff member denied them, no corroborating evidence was found, and the youth making the claim refused to be interviewed and later recanted. The report concludes no policy violations were established, assigning no culpability to the staff member or the facility.
